choices.E: A program and window can be specified as part of a job definition.
choices.A: A job is specified as part of a program definition.
choices.D: A program and schedule can be specified as part of a job definition.
choices.B: A program can be used in the definition of multiple jobs.
choices.C: A program and job can be specified as part of a schedule definition.

questions.question_text: Which three statements correctly describe the relationship amongst jobs, programs, and schedules within the Oracle Job Scheduler?

choices.E: A window in association with a job class controls a resource allocation.
choices.B: A window specifies a job class that will be activated when that window becomes active.
choices.C: A job class specifies a window that will be open when that job class becomes active.
choices.D: A window in association with a resource plan controls a job class allocation.
choices.A: A window specifies a resource plan that will be activated when that window becomes active.

questions.question_text: Which two statements describe the relationship between a window, a resource plan, and a job class?

choices.A: Create both jobs by using Scheduler raised events.
choices.B: Create both jobs using application raised events.
choices.C: Create one job to rebuild indexes using application raised events and another job to perform bulk load using Scheduler raised events.
choices.D: Create one job to rebuild indexes using Scheduler raised events and another job to perform bulk load by using events raised by the application.

questions.question_text:
You wish to create jobs to satisfy these requirements:
1. Automatically bulk load data from a flat file.
2.Rebuild indexes on the SALES table after completion of the bulk load.
How would you create these jobs?

You want to reduce fragmentation and reclaim unused space for the sales table but not its dependent objects. During this operation, you want to ensure the following: i.Long-running queries are not affected. ii.No extra space is used. iii.Data manipulation language (DML) operations on the table succeed at all times throughout the process. iv.Unused space is reclaimed both above and below the high water mark.
Which alter TABLE option would you recommend?

discussion.content: me i think DE is correct , is it right?

choices.D: limiting the degree of parallelism of operations performed by a user or group of users
choices.A: limiting the CPU used per database call
choices.C: specifying the amount of private space a session can allocate in the shared pool of the SGA
choices.E: specifying an idle time limit that applies to sessions that are idle and blocking other sessions
choices.B: specifying the maximum number of concurrent sessions allowed for a user

questions.question_text: For which two requirements would you use the Database Resource Manager?
